question_content.description:
### Problem09


- The process of separating clients from implementations by hiding information is known as _____(0)\___.
- The idea of breaking large programs into small modules that can be developed and debugged independently in computer science can be called as _____(1)\___ programming.
- Java’s language support for enforcing encapsulation is the private access modifier. When you declare an instance variable (or method) to be _____(2)\___, you are making it impossible for any client (code in another class) to directly access that instance variable (or method).
question_content.author: Yantao_Mei
